oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Scene from "Wild River" shows a Tennessee Valley Authority land purchasing office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of a brick building identified on windows as an office for the Tennessee Valley Authority Land Purchasing Division. An electric street lamp hangs on a wire overhead.

The movie "Wild River" (1960) brought attention to the thousands of Tennesseans who had been forced to abandon their homes and land to make way for the Tennessee Valley Authority. The motion picture was directed by Elia Kazan and starred Montgomery Clift and Lee Remick. In the movie, a crusty octoganarian refuses to leave her land.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Motion pictures; Administrative agencies; Studio props
